docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: How to Install and Set Up Visual Studio Code
Overview
docs.text: Visual Studio Code (VS Code) is a lightweight and powerful source code editor from Microsoft. In this guide, you'll learn how to install and configure it on your computer.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Internet connection
  • Windows, macOS, or Linux system
  • Basic understanding of installing applications

docs.title: Step 1: Download VS Code
docs.text:
1. Visit the official website: https://code.visualstudio.com/download
  2. Choose your operating system.
  3. Click Download and wait for the installer.

docs.title: Step 2: Install the Application
docs.text:
1. Run the downloaded installer.
  2. Follow the setup wizard and keep the default options.
  3. Once complete, click Finish.

docs.title: Step 3: Launch VS Code
docs.text:
• Open the application.
  • You should see the Welcome screen.
  • Click File → New File to start coding.

docs.title: Step 4: Optional Setup
docs.text:
• Install useful extensions:
  • Python
  • Prettier
  • Markdown All in One
  • To install: open Extensions panel (Ctrl+Shift+X) → search → click Install.

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text: You’ve successfully installed VS Code! Next, learn to write your first Markdown file or JavaScript project inside it.

docs.title: 🌙 New Feature Alert: Introducing Dark Mode in PocketFridge!
docs.text: We’re thrilled to announce that Dark Mode is now available in the PocketFridge app. You asked, and we delivered — your late-night fridge checks just got easier on the eyes!

docs.title: 🧊 What’s New
docs.text:
• Sleek, modern Dark Theme across the entire app
  • Automatic switching based on your device settings
  • Battery-saving optimization for OLED screens

docs.title: ⚙️ How to Enable Dark Mode
docs.text:
1. Open the PocketFridge app.
  2. Go to Settings → Display Preferences.
  3. Toggle Dark Mode on. You can also set it to Auto to match your system theme.

docs.title: 💡 Why You’ll Love It
docs.text: Dark Mode reduces glare, saves battery life, and just looks cool. It’s perfect for users who love working or browsing at night.

docs.title: 🚀 Update Now
docs.text: Make sure you’re using version 3.2.0 or later to enjoy this new experience. Update via the Google Play Store or App Store.

docs.title: 📣 Feedback
docs.text:
We’d love to hear what you think! Share your thoughts through the Feedback option in the app. V

docs.title: 🌟 Overview
docs.text:
Welcome to Priyanka’s Technical Writing Portfolio — a collection of documentation projects, user guides, and articles that demonstrate my ability to communicate complex technical topics with clarity, accuracy and creativity.

I’m passionate about making technology accessible — turning intricate setups, workflows and software tools into content that helps users learn, build and troubleshoot with confidence.

docs.title: 💼 What You’ll Find Here
docs.text:
This portfolio highlights a variety of technical writing samples that reflect both structure and storytelling:

  • 🧭 User Guides – Clear, step-by-step instructions for real-world software and infrastructure tasks.
  • 🚀 Feature Announcements – Concise release updates written to inform and engage.
  • 💡 Technical Articles & Thought Blogs – Explorations of tools, automation and documentation best practices.
  • 🗂️ System & Process Documentation – Structured explanations of deployments, pipelines and configurations.

Each document focuses on:

  1. Clarity – Simple, reader-friendly explanations.

  2. Technical Accuracy – Verified steps and details.

  3. Visual Support – Diagrams, screenshots, and tables for better understanding.

  4. Consistency – A uniform structure that makes navigation effortless.

docs.title: 🧰 Tools & Skills
docs.text:
• Markup Languages: Markdown, HTML, XML (DITA)

  • Documentation Frameworks: MkDocs, Docusaurus

  • Version Control: Git & GitHub

  • Design Tools: Snagit, Canva, draw.io (for visuals and diagrams)

  • Content Management: Familiar with structured authoring workflows and CMS systems

  • DevOps Knowledge: Jenkins, Docker, Terraform, AWS (hands-on documentation experience)

docs.title: 🌱 About This Portfolio
docs.text:
This site is built using MkDocs with the Material theme, written entirely in Markdown and hosted on GitHub Pages. It’s a living showcase — I continuously add new samples as I explore advanced documentation systems like DITA, FrameMaker and Sphinx.

My goal as a technical writer is to bridge the gap between technology and understanding, creating documentation that’s not only accurate but enjoyable to read.

  • How-To Guides

  • Technical Blogs

Thank you for visiting — and welcome to my world of structured, meaningful, and user-centered documentation. ✨

docs.title: Why Good Documentation is a Developer’s Superpower
Introduction
docs.text: Every developer knows the pain of poor documentation — broken links, missing examples, unclear steps. But when documentation is done right, it becomes the invisible engine that drives productivity.

docs.title: The Real Impact of Clear Docs
docs.text:
• Reduces onboarding time for new developers
  • Cuts support tickets dramatically
  • Builds trust with your users and contributors A well-written README can turn confusion into confidence.

docs.title: Writing is Thinking
docs.text: Technical writing isn’t just typing steps. It’s about understanding why something works and then translating it into simple, actionable language. When you can explain something clearly, it means you’ve mastered it.

docs.title: My Experience
docs.text: When I started documenting projects, I noticed how it forced me to understand my own code better. Clarity in writing brought clarity in thought.

docs.title: Final Thoughts
docs.text:
Good documentation is not “extra work” — it’s a multiplier. It saves hours for every minute invested.

"Docs are where users decide whether they trust your product."

Author: Priyanka V. Date: October 31, 2025
